CommentBody:
We reviewed the setup for StealthAUDIT and noticed the connection profile was set up to use whatever account the customer used to log in to the machine. 
I advised you to create a dedicated service account to launch the application and run the jobs.
 
I noticed the customer needed more permission to query the new DC.
The customer will contact the admin to ensure he is a member of the domain admin group from the domain controller he wants to query.
He will also contact his Azure admin to clarify his Azure permission access level.

In today's meeting, we were able to drop the old domain and use the user ID from the old domain to scan the new domain. Apparently, there is a one-way trust relationship between the old and new domains. The user ID for the new domain is not working because it doesn't have enough permission.
